p.s: Description of Pandoraea sputorum sp. nov.
Pandoraea sputorum (spu.to'.rum. L.n. sputum spit, sputum; L. gen. pl. n. sputorum of sputa)
The description of P. sputorum is the same as that for the genus.

Additional characteristics are: no growth in O/F medium with glucose or on acetamide; no assimilation of sucrose; no arginine dihydrolase activity present; C8-ester lipase and phosphoamidase activity present.
The major fatty acids present are 16:0, 17:0 cyclo, 19:0 cyclo ω8c and summed feature 7.
Isolated from sputum of CF patients.
The type strain is LMG 18819T (=CCUG 39682T), isolated from a CF patient in the USA.
Phenotypic characteristics are the same as described above for the species.
In addition, the type strain reduces nitrate, produces fluoresence on King's B medium and assimilates maltose and dl-lactate.
ItsG­C content is 61.9 mol% and the GenBank accession number for its 16S rDNA sequence is AF139176.
